conclusion: Trace the path of liquid from sources A, B, C to containers D, E, F by following interaction with baffles.
Liquid from source A (orange) flows downward.
Liquid from source A encounters the black baffle first, which deflects it.
Orange liquid follows along the black baffle, moving down and leftward.
After leaving the black baffle, orange liquid continues to flow downward due to gravity.
There appears to be a small orange fragment/droplet in the middle area.
Following the path, the orange liquid would reach the leftmost container (D).
Liquid from source B (teal/mint) flows downward.
Liquid from source B encounters multiple baffles along its path.
Teal liquid creates a path that moves around obstacles.
Teal liquid creates a small teal segment in the middle-left portion of the board.
Following the visible liquid trail, the teal liquid would reach the central-left container (seems to be container E).
Liquid from source C (pink) flows straight downward initially.
Pink liquid forms a dotted/broken line pattern.
Pink liquid encounters the rightmost mint/teal baffle.
Pink liquid flows along the baffle and then continues downward.
Following this trajectory, the pink liquid would reach the rightmost container (F).
Liquid from source A will flow into container D, source B into container E, and source C into container F.
